criterion: Provides unnecessary or irrelevant medical information.
Accurately interprets and responds to the user's symptoms, including the recommended treatment.
Asks follow-up questions to clarify the user's symptoms and medical history.
Uses natural language and avoids jargon or technical terms.
Provides instructions on how to take the recommended medication.
Fails to address the user's concerns about the effectiveness of the recommended treatment.
Incorrectly suggests that the headache is caused by a minor issue and does not recommend seeking medical attention.
Provides an unclear or confusing explanation of the recommended treatment.
Fails to recommend seeking medical attention if the headache persists or worsens.
Accurately addresses the user's concerns about potential side effects of the recommended medication.
Provides a clear and concise summary of the recommended treatment and follow-up instructions.
